Which of the following is NOT true?

A1.text: Mario was originally known as Jumpman. When Nintendo of America was thinking of a better name they were interrupted by their landlord, Mario Segale, whom the character was renamed to.

A2.text: Mario's hat was added because realistic hair was too advanced for the technology at the time of his creation.

A3.text: In 2009, Mario was titled one of the most well known video games characters in the world.

A4.text: Despite Bowser being the key antagonist in the Mario franchise, he helps Mario in the game *Super Mario RPG: Legend of the Seven Stars* in 1996.

questions.question: What was Bowser originally when he was first sketched by Miyamoto?
Which of the following is true for the meaning behind Wario's name?

A1.text: The character was named after Wario Hernandez

A2.text: Blend of "Mario" and the Japanese adjective "warui" meaning evil

A3.text: Evil version of Mario, so the M was flipped upsidedown to a W

A4.text: The developers had the chance to come up with the character's name, and they all felt like Wario was a fitting name that sounded good.

A2.text: Acorn Plains > Layer-Cake Desert > Sparkling Waters > Frosted Glacier > Soda Jungle > Rock-Candy Mines > Merinque Clouds > Peach's Castle > Superstar Road

A3.text: Layer-Cake Desert > Sparkling Waters > Acorn Plains > Frosted Glacier > Soda Jungle > Merinque Clouds > Peach's Castle > Rock-Candy mines > Superstar Road

A4.text: Frosted Glacier > Sparkling Waters > Acorn Plains > Layer-Cake Desert > Soda Jungle > Rock-Candy Mines > Meriqnue Clouds > Peach's Castle > Superstar Road
